intro: Tococa guyanensis var. macrophysca, commonly known as the giant tococa, is a climbing plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, elongated leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible and have a sweet, slightly tart flavor. Its rapid growth and unique morphology make it a notable species in botanical studies. It is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
